titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I received Holy Communion in the Chapel – a small building adorned with much wood carving of the later XVII

century. At 11.a.m we had Mattins, & that sufficed for the religious services of the day, our host going off to preach at Evensong in a country church. In the morning we sate and talked together. After lunch the Bishop took us for an excellent walk. The country was seen to
in the clear fine day. This is certainly a noble house, far more unspoiled than Auckland, and perhaps more commodious. The Hall, stair–case, and drawing room are notable, and the
